intro: Quekettia microscopica var. naboulettiana, commonly known as the miniature orchid, is a rare and diminutive flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its tiny, delicate flowers that are typically less than 1 centimeter in diameter. The plant has a unique morphology, featuring a short, erect stem with a single, lance-shaped leaf. Its flowers are usually pale green or white, with intricate patterns that resemble lace, and it blooms during the cooler months. Due to its extreme rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a critically endangered species.
